Topic.Title: Even apple users were impressed with surface

Message.Msg: An ARM tablet is just a coffee-shop browser. But MS did add a version of Office to their ARM tablet. But tablets with Intel Atom are available and those will run a regular version of Office or apps like Photoshop. One problem with the Surface is that it can't be used as a laptop but requires a table-top. (Some of us have computed sitting on tree stumps, sitting in pickup trucks, and riding in small boats.) But the Samsung ATIV 500T tablet gets the Atom processor AND a different form factor. And there's an 700T model as well. Now, HTC gave up on a large screen Win 8 mobile phone. But see, they can do a large screen Win RT mobile phone. Get it ? A large screen mobile phone is a small screen ARM tablet.

Topic.Title: Sales of Windows in China and India

Message.Msg: In China, Apple is selling with the rising wealth and middle class. They are two markets in CHina, the one looks for brand and quality such as MSFT, APPL and Surface, the other crowd looks for cheap alternative. Business in China uses MSFT as well, try to teach my wife to use Ubuntu is a pain. The salesman in Best buy would not even suggest it or I see it in stock. It's so laughable that a lot of people still think China is the rural cities of the 60. It's 4 times the US population. The wages and GDP is catching up. When the wages are up, automation and the use of MSFT OS and Office will rise to lower cost of production and align with western world. MSFT is investing with R&D center in CHina that turns out at least 10 times more engineers than the states and educated work force. Consumer toy like Apple will not cut it.

Topic.Title: Surface and Windows 8-- the new revolution

Message.Msg: Most users are revolting against Windows 8. I went to a a couple of busy electronics stores this weekend and looked at some laptops. Most were running Windows 8. Then I realized I was the ONLY person in these stores looking at them. The desktop computers were just sitting there collecting dust. Some of the stores didn't even sell desktop computers. Most people were looking at tablets and smartphones. I asked a clerk in one store to see a Lumina 920 phone and noticed I was the only person in the store looking at it. There was a crowd around the iPhone 5 in all of the stores though.

Topic.Title: end of year

Message.Msg: I'm curious to see Microsoft's year end quarterly report next month. It's a good thing MSFT took a big loss last quarter. That way this quarter's bad numbers won't look so bad. So far, Ballmer only says Surface tablet sales are 'modest'. Reviews of Windows 8 laptops aren't so good. Less than 50% of users like it. Desktop computers are dinosaurs from the last millennium. The Fiscal Cliff will prevent Server upgrades. The jury is still out on the Lumina 920 smartphone. Maybe XBox helped MSFT holiday sales? MSFT will be trading in the 24-25 range by Vallentine's day.
